pageContext.description: Loop broken. Finished off by hammering, but not so much as the other one.
pageContext.patina: Greater part crusted with patina, a shiny brown worn through to powdery blue green and in parts grey metal.
pageContext.surface: Poor. Patches of red clay. Golden bronze shows on flange on other side.
pageContext.associations: 1a. Hoard: Found with another Palstave and a Chisel.
pageContext.collection: Private Collection,1923,F. Drinkwater Esq. MRCVS,26 Victoria Drive, West Kirby,from the collection of his uncle the late Rev. C. H. Drinkwater,Vicar of St. George's Shrewsbury 1872 to 1923,Shrewsbury Museum
pageContext.site: England, shropshire,meole brace,hanwood road,se side of road about 1/2 way between hanwood and shrewsbury,in edgebold, brickfield in a pocket of grey gravel in boulder clay 4.5-5 feet deep.,about 1897 or 8.
